ygData.msgSnippet: Ken, This idea steps a little outside the normal use of CPPN s, but I think it would make for an interesting use. Having worked with a number of circuitry part

Subject: Another use
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=310198749; y=E5X_v1rof4jeEf5J0_59PSM1ujT-68RkQiVzgiOCLXzwvQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: erikcss

Ken,

This idea steps a little outside the normal use of CPPN's, but I think it would make for an interesting use. 

Having worked with a number of circuitry part placement and routing programs, I have seen a lot of room for improvement. Considering the nature of the problem and operation of CPPNs, I think evolving a CPPN to place and route traces would be pretty effective and useful. Do you know if anyone has tried to use a CPPN for this purpose?
